keywords.indexterm: DITAApply custom styling to an external transformation

body.p: Suppose that you want to apply custom styling to an external DITA transformation using the for DITA OT. The following procedure provides an example of how you could achieve this using a custom CSS file and some of the parameters.

section.title: External Transformation Customization Example
section.p: To apply your own custom styling to an external DITA transformation using , follow these steps:

ol.li: Download and install a Java Virtual Machine version compatible with the DITA-OT version.
Download and unpack the DITA Open Toolkit version or .

If you have not already done so, copy your license key into a licensekey.txt file and place it in the /plugins/com.oxygenxml.webhelp.classic directory. Do the same for the Responsive variant: copy your license key into a licensekey.txt file and place it in the /plugins/com.oxygenxml.webhelp.responsive directory.
Create a new directory for your custom template (/plugins/com.oxygenxml.webhelp/templates/dita/MyCustomTemplate).
Create a new directory for your custom skin (/plugins/com.oxygenxml.webhelp/templates/dita/MyCustomTemplate/variants/tree/MyCustomSkin).

Copy the /plugins/com.oxygenxml.webhelp/templates/dita/bootstrap/variants/tree/light/skin.css file to the custom skin directory you just created (/plugins/com.oxygenxml.webhelp/templates/dita/MyCustomTemplate/variants/tree/MyCustomSkin).

Copy the /plugins/com.oxygenxml.webhelp/templates/dita/bootstrap/variants/tree/light/resources directory to the custom skin directory you just created (/plugins/com.oxygenxml.webhelp/templates/dita/MyCustomTemplate/variants/tree/MyCustomSkin).

Use your system command console to run a command in the /bin folder that will invoke the external transformation and include the parameters that you desire for your customization.
For example: dita.bat -i c:\myMap.ditamap -f webhelp-responsive -Dwebhelp.responsive.template.name=MyCustomTemplate -Dwebhelp.responsive.variant.name=tree -Dwebhelp.responsive.skin.name=MyCustomSkin -Dargs.breadcrumbs=yes -Dwebhelp.logo.image=c:\Mylogo.png -Dwebhelp.show.side.toc=no -Dwebhelp.show.top.menu=yes -o c:\MyOutputDirectory
Check the output directory to make sure it now contains your custom skin directory.

Modify the /plugins/com.oxygenxml.webhelp/templates/dita/MyCustomTemplate/variants/tree/MyCustomSkin/skin.css file according to your needs and check the output to make sure your custom styles are applied properly.
